content.question:
Half-Reaction
 Standard Reduction Potential <math alttext="in volts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(V)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="N a with a positive 1 charge plus one electron produce N a liquid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>Na</mtext><mtext>(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="negative 2.71" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2.71</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="C l 2 gas plus 2 electrons produce 2 C l with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="positive 1.36 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>1.36</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

The diagram above represents an electrolytic cell in which the reaction <math alttext="2 N a C l liquid reacts to produce 2 N a liquid plus C l 2 gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NaCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Na</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> takes place. The table gives the relevant reduction half-reactions and the standard reduction potentials. Based on the information given, which of the following is true?

choices.label: The operation of the cell generates a potential of <math alttext="1.35 volts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.35</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because the reaction is thermodynamically favorable.

The operation of the cell generates a potential of <math alttext="5.43 volts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.43</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because the reaction is thermodynamically favorable.

The operation of the cell requires at least <math alttext="4.07 volts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.07</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to be supplied because the reaction is not thermodynamically favorable.

The operation of the cell requires at least <math alttext="2.72 volts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.72</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to be supplied because the reaction is not thermodynamically favorable.

content.answer: The operation of the cell requires at least <math alttext="4.07 volts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.07</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to be supplied because the reaction is not thermodynamically favorable.

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
